title: DOC: building page for nested methods doesn't work
raw_output:
{'files_to_modify': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/source/reference/api/', 'doc/make.py', 'doc/sphinxext/', 'sphinx/ext/autosummary.py'], 'reasoning': '1. doc/source/conf.py holds the custom Documenter logic (AccessorDocumenter, AccessorLevelDocumenter, etc.) and PandasAutosummary, which control how Sphinx resolves nested attributes/methods for API doc generation. It is the central place to fix or patch the import resolution logic for pandas.Series.str.rsplit, ensuring walking through attributes (not only importing modules).
2. doc/source/reference/api/ contains the generated API doc pages (.rst files); if templates or generator scripts malfunction, updating them could help fix the breakdown for nested methods.
3. doc/make.py is the documentation build entrypoint and controls the workflow, patterns, and exclusion/inclusion of API docs. Minor changes may be needed if it influences how nested docs are generated.
4. doc/sphinxext/: If accessor or autodoc logic is further customized here (referenced by conf.py), fixes may be needed; otherwise, can be deprioritized.
5. sphinx/ext/autosummary.py is part of the Sphinx package; actual modification should generally happen via monkeypatching in conf.py, but understanding/improving its logic may help guide the fix.'}
